title: Developing Explicit Integration Strategies for PCK, PK, and CK in Teacher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in middle school mathematics education and possession of basic teaching competencies
context.additional_context: Experiential workshops and case studies for in-service math teachers to learn integrated approaches to PCK (Pedagogical Content Knowledge), PK (Pedagogical Knowledge), and CK (Content Knowledge).

learning_goals: Students can explain the conceptual differences between PCK, PK, and CK, and analyze the interaction of each element.
Students can propose at least three strategies for integrating PCK, PK, and CK when designing math lessons.
Students can diagnose their PCK development level and establish improvement plans through peer assessment and feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
